intro: Echinopepon tultitlanapaensis, commonly known as the Tultitlan melon, is a rare species native to the highlands of central Mexico. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, pumpkins, and gourds. The plant produces large, yellow, spherical fruits with a thick, sweet flesh and a distinct, aromatic flavor. Its botanical features include trailing vines with hairy stems and palmate leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
